summary: This document is an email from a Financial Program Specialist at the Federal Bureau of Prisons regarding procurement issues with camera systems at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It references purchase orders for fiber cable and camera systems, indicating technical and documentation delays.

persons.name: Financial Program Specialist
persons.context: Author of the email, works at the United States Department of Justice Federal Bureau of Prisons Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

persons.name: Comp. Tech
persons.context: Advised the Financial Program Specialist on the status of purchase orders, indicating delays in receiving fiber cable and camera systems due to documentation requirements.

connections.description: The Financial Program Specialist consulted the Computer Technician for an update on the status of purchase orders for camera systems.

events.title: Procurement Status Inquiry
events.description: A Financial Program Specialist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center inquired about the status of purchase orders for fiber cable and camera systems, learning of delays due to missing documentation and materials.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional CTR 150 Park Row New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is dated April 1, 2019, and originates from the Federal Bureau of Prisons Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
It discusses procurement delays for camera systems due to an inability to receive required fiber cable.
The company supplying the equipment requires additional documentation before proceeding.
The document is labeled as part of the Epstein case data set (EFTA00117626), suggesting it may relate to security or monitoring systems at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held.
